page.title: 07Ninn Lodge Farm,Great Chart
page.content: Mr. John Smith farms 480 acres at Ninn Lodge Farm.His herd of 110 cows is the main enterprise but he also grows cereals.His land coverage is 240 acres of cereals,30 acres of oil seed rape,25 acres of potatoes and 185 acres for his cattle.His is an extensive farm with only three employees and much machinery,although he hires an extra worker at harvest time and several women to hand pick the potatoes. His cows eat grass in summer and silage in winter and one cow can eat 10 tonnes of silage in one winter.When the calves are born,three quarters are sold with the remaining quarter kept to replace the herd. The recent urban development has reduced the size of his farm and made it necessary for him to pull up hedges to make efficient use of his land.
